net.jbouchard.bool
Class BooleanExpression

java.lang.Object
  net.jbouchard.bool.BooleanExpression

public class BooleanExpression
extends Object

A class to evaluate Boolean expressions composed of values, variables, binary and unary operators, and brackets based on dictionaries mapping variables to values.

Version:
0.1 Beta
Author:
Chris Bouchard

evaluate

public boolean evaluate(Map<String,Boolean> dict)
                 throws ParseException
Evaluate this BooleanExpression for the given dictionary of variables to values and returns the truth value. Throw a ParseException if this BooleanExpression is not properly formatted. A BooleanExpression is not properly formatted if:
  • a binary operator is not preceded and followed by a value or a properly formatted subexpression that reduces to a value
  • a unary operator is not followed by a value or a properly formatted subexpression that reduces to a value
  • an open bracket is not matched by close bracket
  • an unknown symbol appears in the expression

Parameters:
dict - dictionary of variables to values
Returns:
the truth value of this BooleanExpression for the given dictionary
Throws:
ParseException - if this BooleanExpression is not properly formatted.

public Set<BooleanExpression> getSubExpressions()
                                         throws ParseException
Return a set of all subexpressions of at least an operator and a value.
